header.#text:
Reduction of the number of
			 nonessential vehicles purchased and leased by the Federal Government

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the head of the relevant Executive agency, shall complete each of the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Office of Management and Budget

text.#text:
Determine the
			 total dollar amount obligated by each Executive agency to purchase civilian
			 vehicles in fiscal year 2010.

Determine the total dollar amount obligated
			 by each Executive agency to lease civilian vehicles in fiscal year 2010.

Determine the total number of civilian
			 vehicles purchased by each Executive agency in fiscal year 2010.

Determine the total number of civilian
			 vehicles leased by each Executive agency in fiscal year 2010.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Business and Government Operations Improvement Act/s:204/ss:a/p:1
Business and Government Operations Improvement Act/s:204/ss:a/p:2

text.#text: Determine the total dollar amount that would be 20 percent less than the dollar amount determined under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to purchase and lease civilian vehicles.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Business and Government Operations Improvement Act/s:204/ss:a/p:5

text.#text: For each of fiscal years 2013 through 2017, each Executive agency may not obligate more than the dollar amount identified pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall ensure that an Executive agency may share excess or unused vehicles with another Executive agency that may need temporary or long-term use of additional vehicles through the Federal Fleet Management System.
to be essential for reasons of national security.

text.#text: The limits on the purchase and procurement of vehicles provided in this section shall not apply to the purchase or procurement of any vehicle that has been determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Office of Management and Budget

term.#tail: means a vehicle that is not used for purposes of military combat, the training or deployment of uniformed military personnel, or such other uses as determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 105 of title 5, United States Code

term.#tail: has the meaning given that term under

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To reduce the number of nonessential
		  vehicles purchased and leased by the Federal Government, and for other
		  purposes.

Committee on Homeland Security and
			 Governmental Affairs
